page.title: 12Frocester Village Life.
page.content: con't:Leonard Stanley Rd:Brooke House, Froc.Cott.Yew Tree Cott.Spring Farm, Walnut Tree Cott. and Spring Cottage. The C17th.Coaching Inn,at the Cross was known as The George.Most houses are between 100 & 500yrs.old.Today there are few jobs within the village with most'travelling to nearby towns. The station closed in the late'60s.but the proximity of the M5 & A38 roads makes for good communications. The Village School closed before the War and children travel to nearby schs Village activities include a Women's Institute & a thriving Cricket Club.An annual event is the Beer Festival.The small Church of St.Andrew,1590,is used for services.The larger St.Peters was disused & taken down 1955-57.The Tower remains,its bells now at Eastington. Among the Farms,only Bridge Farm has a Pig Herd of 160 Large White Sows.
